choices.A: SSH session into 192.168.100.3 on the ESG.
choices.D: SSH session into 192.168.10.5 on the DLR.

discussion.content: You can console in the Control VM that deals with routing...

The answer should be C?
DLR is a kernel module not a VM, so console is not available but you can telnet to it.

choices.A: When configuring BGP the protocol address is used to forward traffic to peers.
choices.B: When configuring BGP the protocol address is used by the protocol to form adjacencies with peers.
choices.C: When configuring OSPF the protocol address is used to forward traffic to peers.
choices.D: When configuring OSPF the protocol address is used by the protocol to form adjacencies with peers.

questions.question_text: Which are two uses of the NSX DLR protocol address? (Choose two.)

choices.C: If Negate Source is not selected, the rule is applied to traffic coming from all sources except for the source identified under the object type.
choices.B: If Negate Source is selected, the rule is applied to traffic coming from all sources except for the source identified under the object type.
choices.A: If Negate Source is selected, the rule is sent to only the objects identified under object type.
choices.D: if Negate Source is not selected, the rule is sent to only the objects identified under the object type.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
When specifying a source for a security rule, what is the purpose of the Negate Source check box?

discussion.content:
"If Negate Source is selected, the rule is applied to traffic coming from all sources except for the source you specified in the previous step.

If Negate Source is not selected, the rule applies to traffic coming from the source you specified in the previous step."

questions.question_text: What is a requirement of NSX Data Security?

discussion.content:
A, p290 Installation Guide: If the partner solution includes a host-resident virtual appliance, you can deploy the service after the
solution is registered with NSX Manager.
Sooo, looking at the link provided, the answer should be "C", right?
